tools.name: Create Carousel Container
tools.description: Create a draft carousel post with multiple images/videos before publishing.

child_image_files.description: List of local image files to include as children
child_image_files.title: Child Image Files

mimetype.description: The MIME type of the file
mimetype.title: Mimetype

name.description: The filename that will be used when uploading the file to the destination service
name.title: Name

s3key.description: The S3 key of a publicly accessible file, typically returned from a previous download action that stored the file in S3. This key references an existing file that can be uploaded to another service.
s3key.title: S3Key

child_image_urls.description: List of image URLs to include as children
child_image_urls.title: Child Image Urls

child_video_files.description: List of local video files to include as children
child_video_files.title: Child Video Files

mimetype.description: The MIME type of the file
mimetype.title: Mimetype

name.description: The filename that will be used when uploading the file to the destination service
name.title: Name

s3key.description: The S3 key of a publicly accessible file, typically returned from a previous download action that stored the file in S3. This key references an existing file that can be uploaded to another service.
s3key.title: S3Key

child_video_urls.description: List of video URLs to include as children
child_video_urls.title: Child Video Urls

id.description: The unique identifier of the created carousel container. This container ID must be used in subsequent API calls to publish the carousel or check its status.
id.title: Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Create Media Container
tools.description: Create a draft media container for photos/videos/reels before publishing.

content_type.description: What you want to post: 'photo', 'video', 'reel', or 'carousel_item' (for carousel drafts)
content_type.title: Content Type

cover_url.description: Optional cover image URL for reels/videos
cover_url.title: Cover Url

image_file.title: FileUploadable
image_file.description: Local image file to upload. File will be uploaded to a public URL automatically. Use this instead of image_url for local files.

image_url.description: Public URL of the image. Must be a directly downloadable URL (no redirects) accessible to Meta crawlers. Supported formats: JPG, PNG (WebP not supported). Must pass correct Content-Type header, Content-Length header, max 8MB file size, minimum 320px width, aspect ratio between 4:5 and 1.91:1. URL must return the image file directly, not an HTML page.
image_url.title: Image Url

media_type.description: Explicit media type override, e.g., REELS or CAROUSEL.
media_type.title: Media Type

video_file.title: FileUploadable
video_file.description: Local video file to upload. File will be uploaded to a public URL automatically. Use this instead of video_url for local files.

video_url.description: Public URL of the video. Must be a directly downloadable URL (no redirects) accessible to Meta crawlers. Supported formats: MP4, MOV. Must pass correct Content-Type header, Content-Length header, max 100MB file size for feed videos, max 1GB for IGTV, minimum 3 seconds duration. URL must return the video file directly, not an HTML page.
video_url.title: Video Url

id.description: The media container ID (also called creation_id) returned upon successful creation. This ID is used in the subsequent media_publish endpoint to publish the media to Instagram. Container IDs expire after 24 hours if not published.
id.title: Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Create Post
tools.description: Publish a draft media container to Instagram (final publishing step).

creation_id.description: Draft ID returned from create actions
creation_id.title: Creation Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

is_subscribed.description: Indicates whether the page is subscribed to notifications for this conversation

email.description: Email address of the participant, if available
email.title: Email

snippet.description: Preview or excerpt of the most recent message

tags.description: Array of tags associated with the conversation
tags.title: Tags

parent_id.description: ID of the parent comment if this comment is a reply to another comment
parent_id.title: Parent Id

text.description: The text content of the reply

username.description: Username of the commenter. Only returned when the 'from' field is not available

user.description: Deprecated Instagram user object (Graph API v12+).

tools.name: Get Post Insights
tools.description: Get Instagram post insights/analytics (impressions, reach, engagement, etc.).

metric.description: Metrics to retrieve for the media. If not provided and metric_preset is not set, uses auto_safe preset. Allowed metrics vary by media_product_type: IMAGE/CAROUSEL: impressions, reach, likes, comments, saved, shares, engagement. VIDEO: reach, plays, likes, comments, saved, shares (impressions NOT supported). REELS: reach, plays, likes, comments, saved, shares, total_interactions, ig_reels_video_view_total_time, ig_reels_avg_watch_time. Stories: impressions, reach, replies, taps_forward, taps_back, exits. Common unsupported metrics: engagement on REELS (use total_interactions), impressions on VIDEO/Reels. If a metric is unsupported for the post type, API returns 400 error.
metric.title: Metric

metric_preset.description: Predefined metric sets for different media types to avoid API errors.
metric_preset.title: MetricPreset

data.description: Array of insight objects containing metrics for the media
data.title: Data

items.description: Individual insight metric data point.
items.title: InsightData

description.description: Detailed explanation of what the metric measures
description.title: Description

period.description: The time period for the metric (typically 'lifetime' for media insights)
period.title: Period

values.description: Array containing the metric value objects
values.title: Values

items.description: Value object for an insight metric.
items.title: InsightValue

value.description: The numeric value of the metric
value.title: Value

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

paging.description: Pagination object for navigating through results.
paging.title: Paging

after.description: Cursor pointing to the next page of results
after.title: After

before.description: Cursor pointing to the previous page of results
before.title: Before

next.description: Full URL to retrieve the next page of results
next.title: Next

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

status.description: A human-readable status message describing the current state. If status_code is ERROR, this value will be an error sub code.
status.title: Status

status_code.description: The container's publishing status code. Indicates the current state of the media container in the publishing workflow.
status_code.title: Status Code

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Get User Info
tools.description: Get Instagram user info including profile details and statistics.

ig_user_id.description: Instagram Business Account ID (optional, defaults to current user)
ig_user_id.title: Ig User Id

account_type.description: The account type. Possible values: BUSINESS, CREATOR, PERSONAL.
account_type.title: Account Type

biography.description: The biography text of the user's profile.
biography.title: Biography

followers_count.description: The total number of followers of the account. Note: Hidden for accounts with fewer than 100 followers (as of 2025 API updates).
followers_count.title: Followers Count

follows_count.description: The total number of accounts that the user is following.
follows_count.title: Follows Count

ig_id.description: The Instagram user ID (legacy field). Note: This field may be deprecated in future API versions.
ig_id.title: Ig Id

media_count.description: The number of posts (media) published by the user.
media_count.title: Media Count

name.description: The display name of the Instagram account.
name.title: Name

profile_picture_url.description: The URL of the user's profile picture.
profile_picture_url.title: Profile Picture Url

shopping_product_tag_eligibility.description: Indicates whether the account is eligible to tag products in posts for Instagram Shopping.
shopping_product_tag_eligibility.title: Shopping Product Tag Eligibility

website.description: The website URL listed in the user's profile.
website.title: Website

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Get User Insights
tools.description: Get Instagram account-level insights and analytics (profile views, reach, follower count, etc.). metric_type (time_series or total_value): When set to total_value, the API returns a total_value object instead of values. breakdown: Only applicable when metric_type=total_value and only for supported metrics. timeframe: Required for demographics-related metrics and overrides since/until for those metrics.

breakdown.description: Breakdown to use when metric_type=total_value. Allowed values: contact_button_type, follow_type, media_product_type.
breakdown.title: Breakdown

ig_user_id.description: Instagram Business Account ID (optional, defaults to current user)
ig_user_id.title: Ig User Id

metric.description: Metrics to retrieve for the user account. Core metrics: reach, follower_count, profile_views, website_clicks, online_followers. Engagement metrics: accounts_engaged, total_interactions, likes, comments, shares, saves, replies. Activity metrics: follows_and_unfollows, profile_links_taps, views. Demographics metrics (require timeframe parameter): engaged_audience_demographics, reached_audience_demographics, follower_demographics. Threads metrics: threads_likes, threads_replies, reposts, quotes, threads_followers, etc. If multiple metrics are provided, all must support the same period.
metric.title: Metric

items.description:
Valid metrics for Instagram account-level insights.

Core metrics:
- reach, follower_count, profile_views, website_clicks, online_followers

Engagement metrics:
- accounts_engaged, total_interactions, likes, comments, shares, saves, replies

Activity metrics:
- follows_and_unfollows, profile_links_taps, views

Demographics metrics (require timeframe parameter):
- engaged_audience_demographics, reached_audience_demographics, follower_demographics

Threads metrics (for Threads integration):
- threads_likes, threads_replies, reposts, quotes, threads_followers,
  threads_follower_demographics, content_views, threads_views, threads_clicks, threads_reposts
items.title: UserInsightMetric

metric_type.description: Aggregation type for results. Allowed values: time_series, total_value.
metric_type.title: Metric Type

period.description: Aggregation period for insights. Allowed values: day, week, days_28, lifetime. Allowed values depend on metric.
period.title: Period

since.description: Start of time range (inclusive) as a Unix timestamp (seconds). Accepts date strings (YYYY-MM-DD) which will be converted to timestamps.
since.title: Since

timeframe.description: Timeframe for demographics-related metrics; overrides since/until for those metrics. Common values: last_14_days, last_30_days, last_90_days, prev_month, this_month, this_week.
timeframe.title: Timeframe

until.description: End of time range (inclusive) as a Unix timestamp (seconds). Accepts date strings (YYYY-MM-DD) which will be converted to timestamps.
until.title: Until

data.description: Array of insight metric objects containing the requested metrics data
data.title: Data

items.description: Instagram user insight metric data.
items.title: UserInsightData

description.description: Detailed description explaining what the metric measures
description.title: Description

id.description: Unique identifier for this insight metric in the format '{ig-user-id}/insights/{metric-name}/{period}'
id.title: Id

name.description: The name of the metric (e.g., impressions, reach, follower_count, profile_views, email_contacts, phone_call_clicks, text_message_clicks, get_directions_clicks, website_clicks, audience_gender_age, audience_locale, audience_country, audience_city, online_followers, accounts_engaged, total_interactions, likes, comments, shares, saved, replies, engaged_audience_demographics, reached_audience_demographics, follower_demographics, follows_and_unfollows, profile_links_taps)
name.title: Name

period.description: The time period for which the metric is calculated. Possible values: 'lifetime' (for media metrics), 'day', 'week', 'days_28' (for user metrics). Note: Not all metrics support all period types
period.title: Period

total_value.description: Total value object for demographic metrics containing breakdown data.
total_value.title: TotalValue

breakdowns.description: Array of breakdown objects containing dimensional analysis of the audience
breakdowns.title: Breakdowns

items.description: Breakdown containing dimensional analysis of audience metrics.
items.title: Breakdown

dimension_keys.description: Array of dimension names for the breakdown (e.g., ['timeframe', 'country'], ['age'], ['gender'], ['city'])
dimension_keys.title: Dimension Keys

results.description: Array of result objects containing the actual breakdown values
results.title: Results

items.description: Individual result within a breakdown showing dimensional values and count.
items.title: BreakdownResult

dimension_values.description: Array of values corresponding to dimension_keys. For example, ['LAST_90_DAYS', 'AR'] for timeframe and country, or age ranges like '13-17', '18-24', '25-34', '35-44', '45-54', '55-64', '65+'
dimension_values.title: Dimension Values

value.description: The numeric count for this particular dimensional breakdown
value.title: Value

values.description: Array of value objects containing the metric data. For lifetime metrics, this contains a single value object. For time-based periods (day, week, days_28), this can contain multiple value objects with timestamps
values.title: Values

items.description: Individual metric value at a specific time point.
items.title: InsightValue

end_time.description: ISO 8601 formatted timestamp indicating when this metric value was recorded (e.g., '2019-12-20T08:00:00+0000'). Only present for time-based periods (day, week, days_28), not for lifetime metrics
end_time.title: End Time

value.description: The numeric value of the metric at the specified time
value.title: Value

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

paging.description: Pagination object for navigating through multiple pages of results.
paging.title: Paging

after.description: Cursor pointing to the start of the next page of data
after.title: After

before.description: Cursor pointing to the start of the previous page of data
before.title: Before

next.description: Full URL to retrieve the next page of results
next.title: Next

previous.description: Full URL to retrieve the previous page of results
previous.title: Previous

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Send Image
tools.description: Send an image via Instagram DM to a specific user.

attachment_id.description: Returned when sending an attachment with the is_reusable parameter set to true. This ID can be used to send the same file again without re-uploading, improving efficiency for commonly sent media.
attachment_id.title: Attachment Id

message_id.description: Unique identifier for the sent message. Typically starts with 'mid.' prefix (e.g., 'mid.1464375085492:b9606c00ca33c12345'). Used to track message delivery and reference the message in subsequent operations.
message_id.title: Message Id

recipient_id.description: The Instagram Scoped User ID (IGSID) or Page-Scoped ID (PSID) of the message recipient. This is a unique identifier assigned to each user for the specific Instagram Business account or Facebook Page.
recipient_id.title: Recipient Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful

tools.name: Send Text Message
tools.description: Send a text message to an Instagram user via DM.

ig_user_id.description: Instagram Business Account ID (optional when using /me/messages)
ig_user_id.title: Ig User Id

reply_to_message_id.description: Optional message ID to reply to
reply_to_message_id.title: Reply To Message Id

inputParameters.title: SendInstagramMessageRequest
inputParameters.description:
Send a message to an Instagram user via the Messenger API for Instagram.

Requires a valid IG business account token with messaging permissions and the
recipient's PSID (Instagram scoped ID) obtained from prior interactions.

attachment_id.description: Unique identifier for reusable attachments. This field is only present when sending media attachments and can be used to send the same attachment again without re-uploading.
attachment_id.title: Attachment Id

message_id.description: Unique identifier for the sent message. The format follows the pattern 'mid.$' followed by an encoded string (e.g., 'mid.$cAAJoUiFKdHJi-Oj9r1cx6O1cpi6C').
message_id.title: Message Id

recipient_id.description: The Instagram-Scoped User ID (IGSID) of the message recipient. This ID is unique for each Instagram Business account. Note: This field is not returned when using recipient.user_ref or recipient.phone_number to identify the message recipient.
recipient_id.title: Recipient Id

error.description: Error if any occurred during the execution of the action
error.title: Error

successful.description: Whether or not the action execution was successful or not
successful.title: Successful
